description:
This is an introductory level course that will teach basic insurance principles and provide basic foundation level information on health insurance terminology and plan types.

The target audience for this course is anyone who:

  • Is confused by health insurance terminology and plan types.
  • Has health insurance but does not understand how it works.
  • Knows they need insurance of any kind but doesnâ€™t understand the purpose or benefit to having it.
  • Wants to get more out of their health insurance plan.
  • Wants to be more informed before the next time they enroll in a health insurance plan.

The target audience described above should take this course to:

  • Get their questions answered.
  • Understand insurance terminology.
  • Gain clarity and confidence in the subject matter of insurance.
  • Make the most informed decision possible before their next open enrollment period.

Terminology this course should be found under would include: insurance, insurance principles, basics of insurance, basics of health insurance, health insurance, healthcare insurance, health insurance plans, and health insurance plan types.

  • There are no additional materials attached to this course content at this time.
  • The course should take about 40minutes to complete.
  • The course is structured sequentially by lecture number with audio explanations of slide content.
  • This course would not likely be of interest (no new learning expected) for anyone who works in the insurance or healthcare industry.
  • This course does not address funding for healthcare expenses (i.e. Health Reimbursement Accounts or Health Savings Accounts); I can cover that in another course if there is interest.
title: Insurance Principles and Basics of Health Insurance
